hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: From Mudhaj, brother of al-Aswad ibn Qais, transmitted from Umar and Abdullah. Multiple narrations about Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid: First - Narrated by Muhammad ibn Ubayd: Ismail ibn Abi Khalid narrated to us, from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman, from his father, he said: We came to Umar intending to ask him about wiping upon the leather socks. He stood, urinated, then performed ablution and wiped upon his socks. We said: We came to you only to ask you about wiping upon the leather socks. He said: I did this only for your sake. Second - Abd al-Rahman ibn Muhammad al-Muharibi narrated from al-Hassan ibn Ubaidullah: Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid used to dye his beard. Third - Hafs ibn Ghiyath narrated: Al-Hassan ibn Ubaidullah narrated to us: I saw Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid prostrating in a Syrian hood.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Mu'awiyah al-Darir and Ya'la ibn Ubayd, they said: Al-A'mash narrated to us, from Muslim, he said: I saw on Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid a thick-layered turban. Ya'la said in his narration: I saw him praying, and he prostrated on the turban folds. Abu Mu'awiyah said in his narration: It came between his forehead and the ground.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ya'la ibn Ubayd: Al-Ajlah narrated to us, from Ubaid ibn Lahiq, he said: The Prophet ﷺ was on a journey. One man from the people descended and drove the camels while reciting poetry, then another descended. Then the Prophet ﷺ decided to help his companions, so he descended and began to say: Jundub - what is Jundub, and the one-handed one - Zayd is the good. Then he rode, and his companions approached him, saying: O Messenger of Allah ﷺ, we heard you tonight saying: Jundub - what is Jundub, and the one-handed one - Zayd is the good. He said: Two men shall be in this nation. One of them strikes a blow that divides between truth and falsehood, and the other has his hand cut off in the way of Allah, then Allah joins the end of his body with the beginning of it. Al-Ajlah said: As for Jundub, he killed the sorcerer at the time of al-Walid ibn Uqbah, and as for Zayd, his hand was cut off at Jalula, and he was killed on the day of the Camel.

potential_issues.issue: Historical narrative with editorial commentary
potential_issues.impact: The hadith includes editorial commentary from al-Ajlah identifying who Jundub and Zayd are, which adds interpretive context.

Topics: Incident of the Prophet ﷺ reciting verse about Jundub and Zayd
Prophecy about two men in the nation
Incident of Jundub killing the sorcerer
Incident of Zayd ibn Suhan losing his hand at Jalula

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ya'la ibn Ubayd: Al-A'mash narrated from Ibrahim, he said: Zayd ibn Suhan was narrating, and a Bedouin said to him: Your hadith delights me, but your hand disturbs me. Zayd said: Do you not see it is my left hand? The Bedouin said: By Allah, I do not know whether they cut off the right hand or the left hand. Zayd said: Allah spoke the truth - the Bedouin are most severe in disbelief and hypocrisy and most apt not to know the bounds of what Allah has revealed to His Messenger [Quran 9:97]. Al-A'mash said: Zayd's hand was cut off at Nahawand.

narrators.name: Ya'la ibn Ubayd
narrators.full_name: Ya'la ibn Ubayd al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Al-A'mash

chainIssues: Al-A'mash is a known mudallis (Category 2) but uses explicit direct transmission term (حَدَّثَنَا), which is acceptable

potential_issues.issue: Al-A'mash is a known mudallis (Category 2)
potential_issues.impact: Al-A'mash is classified as a Category 2 mudallis, but he uses explicit direct transmission terms (حَدَّثَنَا), which is acceptable. He is still considered reliable by the majority of scholars.

Topics: Dialogue between Zayd ibn Suhan and a Bedouin about his missing hand
Quranic verse recitation about Bedouins' disbelief
Biographical note on Zayd's hand amputation at Nahawand

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Affan ibn Muslim: Hammad ibn Salamah narrated from Abu al-Tayyah, from Abdullah ibn Abi al-Hudhayl, that when the delegation from the people of Kufa came to Umar, and among them was Zayd ibn Suhan, a man from the people of Sham came asking for aid. Umar said to the people of Kufa: You are the treasure of the people of Islam. If the people of Basrah ask for aid from you, you will aid them, and if the people of Sham ask for aid from you, you will aid them. Umar arranged for Zayd (on the mount), and said to the people: Do this for Zayd. Otherwise, I will punish you.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Shihab ibn Abad al-Abdi: Muhammad ibn Fudayl ibn Ghazwan narrated from al-Ajlah, from ibn Abi al-Hudhayl, he said: Umar ibn al-Khattab summoned Zayd ibn Suhan and placed him on the mount as you place your commanders, then he turned to the people and said: Do this for Zayd and the companions of Zayd.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hisham Abu al-Walid al-Tayalisi and Ya'qub ibn Ishaq al-Hadhrami: Abu Awanah informed us, from Simak, from an-Nu'man Abu Qudamah, that he was in an army under Salman al-Farsi, and Zayd ibn Suhan was leading them in prayer, as Salman commanded him to do.
